definitions.definition: that cannot live forever and must die
causing death or likely to cause death; very serious

examples.text: Her reputation suffered a mortal blow as a result of the scandal.
They were locked **in mortal combat** *(= a fight that will only end with the death of one of them)*.
We lived **in mortal dread** of him discovering our secret.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin mortalis, from mors, mort- ‘death’.
